name: get_current_datetime
description: Call this function whenever discussing current events, recent developments, or when time-sensitive information is needed. This function returns the current date, time, and other temporal information needed to provide accurate, up-to-date responses.

format.description: The format of the datetime information to return. 'full', 'date_only', 'time_only' or 'year_only' are your options. Default is 'full' if not specified.

name: open_path
description: Opens a specified file, folder, or application on the user's computer using the default operating system handler, or opens a URL in the default web browser. Use for launching apps, documents, folders, or websites mentioned by the user. Ask user for their username in system, if needed. If user mention that they are on non Windows OS adjust commands accordingly.

target.description: The target to open. Can be an absolute file path (e.g., '/Users/(username)/file.txt'), a folder path (e.g., 'C:\Users\(username)\Documents'), or a full URL (e.g., 'https://www.google.com'). User is using Windows 11, when you need to open an application define a path to it in this OS. Use this tool to open web search result url for user command.

name: manage_clipboard
description: Manages the system clipboard. Can read the current text content from the clipboard or write new text content to it. Useful for transferring text between Alice and other applications.

action.description: Specifies the operation to perform: 'read' to get text from the clipboard, 'write' to put text onto the clipboard.

content.description: The text content to write to the clipboard. Required only when the action is 'write'. Ignored for 'read'.

name: search_torrents
description: Searches for torrents using Jackett. Use this tool when the user asks to find or download a specific movie, TV show, or file.

query.description: The name of the movie, show, or content to search for.

name: add_torrent_to_qb
description: Adds a torrent to qBittorrent using a magnet link. Use this tool when the user selects or confirms a torrent to download.

magnet.description: The magnet link of the torrent to be added to the download queue.

name: save_memory
description: Store a long-term memory about the User. The memory should be a short, clear description that you can recall later to better understand and assist him. For example: 'User, enjoys hiking in the mountains.' Categorize the memory by type (e.g., 'personal', 'work', 'hobby').

content.description: The memory content to store. It should be a brief but meaningful description of the fact or event.

memoryType.description: The type of memory, like 'personal', 'work', 'hobby'. Default is 'general'.

name: delete_memory
description: Forget a long-term memory about User by permanently deleting it from storage. Use this if the memory is no longer valid or User asks you to forget it.

id.description: The unique ID of the memory to delete. This ID identifies exactly which memory should be removed.

name: recall_memories
description: Retrieve long-term memories stored about the User. Use the query parameter to find memories relevant to a specific topic or context. If query is omitted, recent memories are returned.

query.description: The topic, question, or context to find relevant memories for. Omit to get recent general memories.

memoryType.description: Filter memories by type (e.g., 'personal', 'work'). Can be combined with a query.

name: get_unread_emails
description: Fetches a list of recent unread emails from the user's Gmail. Provides subject, sender, and snippet for each.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of unread emails to fetch. Defaults to 5 if not specified.

name: search_emails
description: Searches emails in the user's Gmail based on a query, date range, or other criteria. Provides subject, sender, and snippet.

query.description: The search query. Examples: 'from:boss@example.com', 'subject:project update', 'after:2024/01/15 before:2024/01/20', 'is:important'.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of emails to return. Defaults to 10.

name: get_email_content
description: Fetches the detailed content of a specific email using its message ID. Use this after 'get_unread_emails' or 'search_emails' if the user wants to read a specific email.

messageId.description: The ID of the email message to fetch.

name: get_calendar_events
description: Fetches events directly from the user's Google Calendar. Use this to find out what's on the user's schedule. You can specify a date range or search query.

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. Defaults to 'primary' if not specified.

timeMin.description: The start of the time range (ISO 8601 date-time string, e.g., '2025-06-03T00:00:00Z') for which to fetch events. If not provided, defaults to the current time for open-ended future searches.

timeMax.description: The end of the time range (ISO 8601 date-time string, e.g., '2025-06-03T23:59:59Z') for which to fetch events. If not provided, allows fetching events indefinitely into the future from timeMin.

q.description: Free text search query to find events (e.g., 'Dentist appointment', 'Birthday party').

maxResults.description: The maximum number of events to return. Defaults to 10 if not specified.

name: create_calendar_event
description: Creates a new event in the user's Google Calendar. Requires event summary, start, and end times.

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. Defaults to 'primary' if not specified.

summary.description: The title or summary of the event (e.g., 'Meeting with John').

description.description: A more detailed description of the event (optional).

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the event in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-06-03T14:00:00-07:00'). Include timezone offset if known.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the event in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-06-03T15:00:00-07:00'). Include timezone offset if known.

location.description: The location of the event (optional, e.g., 'Conference Room A' or an address).

attendees.description: A list of email addresses of attendees to invite (optional).

name: update_calendar_event
description: Updates an existing event in the user's Google Calendar. Requires the event ID and at least one field to update.

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. Defaults to 'primary' if not specified.

eventId.description: The unique ID of the event to update.

summary.description: The new title or summary for the event (optional).

description.description: The new detailed description for the event (optional).

startDateTime.description: The new start date and time in ISO 8601 format (optional).

endDateTime.description: The new end date and time in ISO 8601 format (optional).

location.description: The new location for the event (optional).

attendees.description: A new list of email addresses of attendees (optional). This will replace existing attendees.

name: delete_calendar_event
description: Deletes an event from the user's Google Calendar. Requires the event ID.

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. Defaults to 'primary' if not specified.

eventId.description: The unique ID of the event to delete.

name: list_directory
description: Lists the files and folders in a specified directory on the user's computer. Use this to explore the file system.

path.description: The absolute path of the directory to list.

name: execute_command
description: Executes a shell command on the user's computer. For security, only a limited set of commands are allowed. Use this to perform simple tasks like getting the current IP address or running a script.
